options.A: patient presents with peripheral neuropathy, and his symptoms were provoked after minor surgery. Which vitamin deficiency should be considered?

question_text: Regarding the age of onset of myasthenia gravis (MG), which of the following statements is correct?

options.A: Female in the 3rd decade, male in the 6th and 7th decades
options.B: Female in the 5th decade, male in the 3rd decade
options.C: Female in the 2nd decade, male in the 6th and 7th decades
options.D: Female and male both commonly present in the 4th decade

question_text: Which of the following is most common in the pathophysiology of Myasthenia Gravis (MG)?

options.A: Acetylcholine binding

Intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG)

options.A: Azathioprine

question_text: In a patient with Bell's palsy, which muscle is involved?

options.A: Stylohyoid

question_text: What is the cause of prolonged duration and drop amplitude in CMAP?

options.A: Low temperature

options.A: Onion rings

options.A: Perifascicular atrophy

question_text: In a case of dermatomyositis, what are the histology findings?

options.A: Perifascicular atrophy

options.A: Central scotoma

question_text: In a case of relative afferent pupillary defect (RAPD) in the right eye with right homonymous hemianopia, what is the localization?

options.A: Left optic tract

question_text: In Horner's syndrome, what can hydroxyamphetamine do?

options.A: Confirm Horner's syndrome
options.B: Differentiate third-order neuron from first and second-order neurons

options.A: Prolonged P100 latency in the right eye
options.B: Increased amplitude of the P100 wave
options.D: Absent VEP response in the left eye
